tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE GenomicData (
  id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  rsid STRING,
  chromosome STRING,
  position INT,
  allele1 STRING,
  allele2 STRING,
  genotype STRING
);

CREATE TABLE genotypes (id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  sample_id INT,
  snp_id INT,
  allele1 VARCHAR(1),
  allele2 VARCHAR(1),
  genotype_quality FLOAT);

CREATE TABLE samples (id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  sample_name VARCHAR(50),
  patient_id INT,
  date_collected TIMESTAMPTZ);

CREATE TABLE snps (id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  rsid VARCHAR(15),
  chromosome INT,
  position INT);

CREATE TABLE associations (id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  snp_id INT,
  phenotype_id INT,
  p_value FLOAT,
  correlation FLOAT);

CREATE TABLE genomics_data_studies (study_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
                           study_name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
                           study_description TEXT,
                           study_type VARCHAR(50));

CREATE TABLE research_subjects (subject_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
                          subject_name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
                          subject_age INT,
                          subject_gender VARCHAR(10));

CREATE TABLE genetic_variants (variant_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
                          variant_name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
                          variant_chromosome VARCHAR(5),
                          variant_position INT);

CREATE TABLE study_results (result_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
                         study_id INT,
                         subject_id INT,
                         variant_id INT,
                         phenotype_id INT,
                         result_value FLOAT,
                         FOREIGN KEY (study_id) REFERENCES genomics_data_studies(study_id),
                         FOREIGN KEY (subject_id) REFERENCES research_subjects(subject_id),
                         FOREIGN KEY (variant_id) REFERENCES genetic_variants(variant_id),
                         FOREIGN KEY (phenotype_id) REFERENCES phenotype_data(phenotype_id));
